wordpressPost.title: Are married couples really happy?
wordpressPost.content:
Are married couples really happy?

After a deep and dreaded argument with my husband, a fight that seemed to cut much deeper than our regular bickering that we do on a daily basis, I asked my daughter to confirm the answer to a question that I had and that was

“Is any married couple really happy?”  And, “What couple can you name that is happily married?”

As we went through the list of every married couple we know, we couldn’t come up with a single couple that we could use as an example of being truly passionate ( like in the movies) and, it didn’t matter how long they were married.

Now I know that even the healthiest marriages aren’t 100% conflict free.  Couples have to settle into the real world of jobs, bills, kids, etc. but I’d like to think that there are couples who have a lot of passion just as they may have had since day one.

The question I have is, for us women  did we have passion in the beginning and then we lost it  or, no passion at all or worse, did we just get bitter and become bitchy?

I sat down with my husband and asked him what he didn’t like about our relationship and about me.  Of course I was totally expecting him to say “There is nothing wrong with us and especially, nothing wrong with you.”

Matter of fact, I don’t think that you shop or go to the spa enough is what I was hoping for.  (Okay, that was me dreaming while he was talking).  But instead, he seemed to be elated that I had finally asked.

Here it comes! “I want us to think alike and I want us to be more on the same page.” Translation: I want you to be less like you and more like me.

Instead of blurting out the word “Whatever” like I usually do, I thought I would try something different and give him what he wants for the next ninety days to see if it makes a difference or it compromises who I am.

So, here is to the next ninety days to stop being me and and be a better wife.

I’ll keep you posted!
